results.title: The Land Before Time
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The land before time is an animated tale of dinosaurs who long ago roamed the land that was threatened by earthquakes and volcanoes. A young brontosaurus named Littlefoot sets off in search of the legendary Great Valley where dinosaurs can thrive and live in peace. Along the way he makes friends with four other dinosaurs. During their journey they encounter incredible adventures and obstacles and learn unforgettable lessons about life and what it means to stick together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Warrnambool veterans]
results.brief_description: Fourteen veterans tell their stories, from the Australian Army, the Royal Australian Navy, and the Royal Australian Air Force. They share their memories from World War II, the Korean and Vietnam Wars and from the Australian home front. Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.

results.title: The Joker to the thief
results.brief_description: A surreal hand-drawn computer animation of a thief who steals his way into a mediaeval castle. Filled with hallucenogenic imagery the thief is surrounded by magic, scenes of madness and other horrors. He attempts to flee but is followed by the joker equipped with his tricks.
results.description: A surreal hand-drawn computer animation of a thief who steals his way into a mediaeval castle. Filled with hallucenogenic imagery the thief is surrounded by magic, scenes of madness and other horrors. He attempts to flee but is followed by the joker equipped with his tricks.

results.title: [Washing machine: Santa]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. When people co-habit there are usually differences in how we choose to live. Santa and his live-in unicorn ‘creature’ have theirs because what is one person’s washing machine is another’s Jacuzzi.
